encode

Class ZipHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • encode.ZipHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Zipper

    public class ZipHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Zipper
    This class zips and unzips files. It offers methods that use the java.util.zip package. It therefore receives auto updates when that package is updated. It's methods make it easier to use the idea of the package.
    Since:
    20-8-2014
    Version:
    21-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    ZipFile, File

      • unzip

        public void unzip()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Unzips the file given by the constructor. This is equivalent to unzip(ZipFile) where the given ZipFile is the zipped parameter.
        Specified by:
        unzip in interface Zipper
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurs.

      • unzip

        public void unzip(java.lang.String dir)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Unzips the file given by the constructor. This is equivalent to unzip(ZipFile, String) where the given ZipFile is the zipped parameter.
        Parameters:
        dir - The name of the directory to place it in.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IOException occurs.

      • zip

        public void zip(java.lang.String zipname)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Zips files into a zipfile with the given name. To use this method you should have used one of the following constructors: ZipHandler(File...) or ZipHandler(String...)
        Specified by:
        zip in interface Zipper
        Parameters:
        zipname - The name of the ZipFile.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurs.
        See Also:
        ZipHandler(File...), ZipHandler(String...)

      • entries

        public java.util.Enumeration<? extends java.util.zip.ZipEntry> entries()
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns an enumeration of entries over the ZipFile used by this class.
        Returns:
        An enumeration of ZipEntries.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - if the zip file has been closed

      • stream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<? extends java.util.zip.ZipEntry> stream()
                                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return an ordered Stream of the ZIP file entries inside the ZipFile parameter used by this class. Entries appear in the Stream in the order they appear in the central directory of the ZIP file.
        Returns:
        an ordered Stream of entries in this ZIP file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - if the zip file has been closed
